Key Arguments: The bill will suppress opinions that do not align with the ACMA, effectively ending debate.
It violates the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, specifically the right to freedom of opinion and expression.
The bill is seen as a step towards dictatorship, allowing the government to label opposing views as misinformation.
It will restrict information on digital platforms, while exempting government communications.
The bill could criminalize religious beliefs and suppress freedom of religion.
The legislation is viewed as a threat to freedom of speech and democracy.
Notable Quotes: This bill is an attack on free speech as never seen before in Australia.
The Labor party want this bill in place because they want a dictatorship.
Freedom of speech must be upheld as a right for every individual.
